author: Online
title: Lions, Knights clash today
text:
8 a.m.- Mapua vs CSB (jrs) 10 a.m.- Arellano vs EAC (jrs) 12 nn.- Mapua vs St. CSB (srs) 2 p.m.- AU vs EAC (srs) 4 p.m.- Letran vs SBC (srs) 6 p.m.- Letran vs SBC (srs) 
Fierce rivals Letran and San Beda gun for an outright Final Four slot and a twice-to-beat advantage as the two collide today in the 91st NCAA basektball tournament at The Arena in San Juan City. 
The Knights lead the way with a 12-4 (win-loss) record while the Lions are at second with a 12-5 slate but the winner in their 4 p.m. showdown will not only clinch the solo lead but will also book outright Final Four entry and the vital incentive that goes with it. 
The loser will fall to No. 2 and allow Jose Rizal (11-6), Arellano U (11-6), Perpetual Help (11-6) and Mapua (10-6) to catch up on the former. 
Letran coach Aldin Ayo considers the Letran-San Beda duel as make-or-break. 
“It will be an important game for both of us, I consider it a do-or-die game considering how the Final Four race is shaping up,” said Ayo. 
Meanwhile, Management Committee chair Melchor Divina of Mapua said the net proceeds of the Letran-San Beda duel will go to former NCAA player and PBA star Samboy Lim, who is recovering from a heart attack he suffered that sent him into a coma last year. 
The Knights seized the top spot after turning back the Arellano U Chiefs, 87-81, on Sept. 25 and watched the latter pull off a shock 91-72 rout of the Lions last Thursday that sent the reigning five-peat champions down to No. 2. 
Letran will also be coming into the game knowing it has beaten San Beda, 93-80, in their first round encounter on July 16. 
Interestingly, it was the same game when San Beda skipper Baser Amer dislocated his shoulder that sidelined him for the next two months. 
“It’s a must-win for us also not just because we’re playing for pride but also for survival,” said Jarin. 
Also fighting for dear life are Arellano and Mapua, which faces off with ousted St. Benilde and Emilio Aguinaldo College at 12 noon and 2 p.m. Related
